Article.Abstract: A single antibody was shown to adopt different binding-site conformations and thereby bind unrelated antigens. Analysis by both x-ray crystallography and pre-steady-state kinetics revealed an equilibrium between different preexisting isomers, one of which possessed a promiscuous, low-affinity binding site for aromatic ligands, including the immunizing hapten. A subsequent induced-fit isomerization led to high-affinity complexes with a deep and narrow binding site. A protein antigen identified by repertoire selection made use of an unrelated antibody isomer with a wide, shallow binding site. Conformational diversity, whereby one sequence adopts multiple structures and multiple functions, can increase the effective size of the antibody repertoire but may also lead to autoimmunity and allergy.
Article.ArticleTitle: Antibody multispecificity mediated by conformational diversity.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antibodies, Monoclonal;Antigen-Antibody Complex;Antigens;Haptens;Immunoglobulin Fragments;Ligands;Peptide Library;Recombinant Proteins;immunoglobulin Fv;Immunoglobulin E;2,4-Dinitrophenol
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: 2,4-Dinitrophenol(immunology); Amino Acid Sequence; Antibodies, Monoclonal(chemistry; immunology); Antibody Diversity; Antibody Specificity; Antigen-Antibody Complex; Antigen-Antibody Reactions; Antigens(immunology); Binding Sites, Antibody; Cross Reactions; Crystallization; Crystallography, X-Ray; Dimerization; Haptens(immunology); Hydrogen Bonding; Immunoglobulin E(chemistry; immunology); Immunoglobulin Fragments(chemistry; immunology); Isomerism; Kinetics; Ligands; Models, Molecular; Molecular Sequence Data; Peptide Library; Protein Conformation; Recombinant Proteins(immunology)

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Generation of the monoclonal antibody was previously described in the cited reference: Eshhar et al. (1980) J Immunol 124(2): 775-780 [PMID: 7188700]. Spleen cells from immunized mice were adoptively transferred into irradiated syngeneic recipients followed by an i.p. injection of 2 μg DNP-KLH in alum into the recipient. The splenocytes from the recipient mice were obtained 4 to 5 days after the adoptive transfer and used to generate the hybridomas for mAb production.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The affinity of epitope-specific antibody SPE7 for binding to DNP-Ser was determined at equilibrium by fluorescence quenching titration.

BCell.LocationOfData: Tables 1, S2, Figures 2, S5 and PDB 1OAU

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Generation of the monoclonal antibody was previously described in the cited reference: Eshhar et al. (1980) J Immunol 124(2): 775-780 [PMID: 7188700]. Spleen cells from immunized mice were adoptively transferred into irradiated syngeneic recipients followed by an i.p. injection of 2 μg DNP-KLH in alum into the recipient. The splenocytes from the recipient mice were obtained 4 to 5 days after the adoptive transfer and used to generate the hybridomas for mAb production.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The crystal structure of the DNP-Ser in complex with the epitope-specific Fv heterodimer of SPE7 was determined.

ThreeDimensionalStructureOfComplex.Comments: The antibody bound to this antigen has a different conformation than in unbound states [PDB: 1OAQ, 1OCW] and protein-bound state [PDB: 1OAZ], but has the same conformation while bound to two other haptens [PDB: 1OAR, 1OAY].

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Generation of the monoclonal antibody was previously described in the cited reference: Eshhar et al. (1980) J Immunol 124(2): 775-780 [PMID: 7188700]. Spleen cells from immunized mice were adoptively transferred into irradiated syngeneic recipients followed by an i.p. injection of 2 μg DNP-KLH in alum into the recipient. The splenocytes from the recipient mice were obtained 4 to 5 days after the adoptive transfer and used to generate the hybridomas for mAb production.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The affinity of antibody SPE7 for binding to the epitope was determined at equilibrium by fluorescence quenching titration.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Generation of the monoclonal antibody was previously described in the cited reference: Eshhar et al. (1980) J Immunol 124(2): 775-780 [PMID: 7188700]. Spleen cells from immunized mice were adoptively transferred into irradiated syngeneic recipients followed by an i.p. injection of 2 μg DNP-KLH in alum into the recipient. The splenocytes from the recipient mice were obtained 4 to 5 days after the adoptive transfer and used to generate the hybridomas for mAb production.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The crystal structure of the epitope in complex with the Fv heterodimer of SPE7 was determined. There are four complexes in the asymmetric unit.

ThreeDimensionalStructureOfComplex.Comments: The antibody bound to this antigen has a different conformation in unbound states [PDB: 1OAQ, 1OCW] and protein-bound state [PDB: 1OAZ], but has the same conformation while bound to two other haptens [PDB: 1OAU, 1OAY].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The affinity of antibody SPE7 for binding to the epitope was determined at equilibrium by competitive ELISA .

Spleen cells from immunized mice were adoptively transferred into irradiated syngeneic recipients followed by an i.p. injection of 2 μg DNP-KLH in alum into the recipient. The splenocytes from the recipient mice were obtained 4 to 5 days after the adoptive transfer and used to generate the hybridomas for mAb production.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The crystal structure of the epitope in complex with the Fv heterodimer of SPE7 was determined. There are two complexes in the asymmetric unit.

ThreeDimensionalStructureOfComplex.Comments: The antibody bound to this antigen has a different conformation in unbound states [PDB: 1OAQ, 1OCW] and protein-bound state [PDB: 1OAZ], but has the same conformation while bound to two other haptens [PDB: 1OAU, 1OAR].

BCell.LocationOfData: Figures 2, 4, 5, S5, Tables 1, S2 and PDB 1OAZ

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Generation of the monoclonal antibody was previously described in the cited reference: Eshhar et al. (1980) J Immunol 124(2): 775-780 [PMID: 7188700]. Spleen cells from immunized mice were adoptively transferred into irradiated syngeneic recipients followed by an i.p. injection of 2 μg DNP-KLH in alum into the recipient. The splenocytes from the recipient mice were obtained 4 to 5 days after the adoptive transfer and used to generate the hybridomas for mAb production.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The crystal structure of DNP hapten-specific antibody SPE7 Fv heterodimer in complex with the epitope peptide expressed on the active-site loop of thioredoxin (Trx) was determined. The epitope was selected from a peptide library expressed as cyclic peptides on the Trx display system. Some residues of the Trx molecule (104KVGALS109) are also contacted by the antibody. There are two complexes in the asymmetric unit.

ThreeDimensionalStructureOfComplex.Comments: In contrast to the deep and narrow hapten-binding sites observed in the complexes of SPE7 Fv with haptens [PDB: 1OAU, 1OAY, 1OAR], in this complex SPE7 adopts a rather shallow, solvent-exposed binding site reminiscent of protein-binding antibodies.

BCell.LocationOfData: Figures 2, 4, 5, S5, Tables 1, S2 and PDB 1OAZ

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Generation of the monoclonal antibody was previously described in the cited reference: Eshhar et al. (1980) J Immunol 124(2): 775-780 [PMID: 7188700]. Spleen cells from immunized mice were adoptively transferred into irradiated syngeneic recipients followed by an i.p. injection of 2 μg DNP-KLH in alum into the recipient. The splenocytes from the recipient mice were obtained 4 to 5 days after the adoptive transfer and used to generate the hybridomas for mAb production.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The crystal structure of DNP hapten-specific antibody SPE7 Fv heterodimer in complex with the epitope peptide expressed on the active-site loop of thioredoxin (Trx) was determined. The epitope was selected from a peptide library expressed as cyclic peptides on the Trx display system. Some residues of the Trx molecule (104KVGALS109) are also contacted by the antibody.

ThreeDimensionalStructureOfComplex.Comments: In contrast to the deep and narrow hapten-binding sites observed in the complexes of SPE7 Fv with haptens [PDB: 1OAU, 1OAY, 1OAR], in this complex SPE7 adopts a rather shallow, solvent-exposed binding site reminiscent of protein-binding antibodies.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Generation of the monoclonal antibody was previously described in the cited reference: Eshhar et al. (1980) J Immunol 124(2): 775-780 [PMID: 7188700]. Spleen cells from immunized mice were adoptively transferred into irradiated syngeneic recipients followed by an i.p. injection of 2 μg DNP-KLH in alum into the recipient. The splenocytes from the recipient mice were obtained 4 to 5 days after the adoptive transfer and used to generate the hybridomas for mAb production.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The crystal structure of the epitope in complex with the Fv heterodimer of SPE7 was determined. The structure [PDB: 1OAX] is also described in reference [PMID: 14500876]. There are two complexes in the asymmetric unit.
